thesisText.subtitle:
BACHELOR’S DEGREE THESIS
AWARD WINNING · GRADED WITH HONOURS

beforeRedesign: Before the redesign, the Complutense University of Madrid Information Service had a fragmented visual identity, with inconsistent styles and a hard-to-read logo. The brand guidelines were unclear, and the website suffered from poor navigation, visual clutter, and inconsistent design. Social media content lacked coherence and adaptation to each platform, while brand materials showed technical errors and inconsistency. Limited budget and non-specialized staff made it urgent to develop a more sustainable, accessible, and professional communication system.
logoParagraph: The logo uses a puzzle-piece metaphor to represent the connection of ideas. The letters “C” and “I” interact playfully, forming either two characters or a single smiling face through Gestalt closure. The filled and outlined forms reflect the diversity of the audience.
logoFontParagraph: The Gulax typeface was selected for the logo, but specific characters were modified using the open-source software FontForge to better align the type with the academic and informational identity of CompluInforma.
bookmarkCaption: Promotional bookmark design and Bachelor’s Degree thesis report
credentialCaption: Employee credential design and informative guide brochure template
manualParagraph: This project relies on the formation of non specialized staff to create consistent and clean graphic design results through the open-source platform PenPot, in which employees can find templates of different forms of content created by me, which comply to the brand’s image and guidelines.
handbookParagraph: This is complemented by the Graphic Design Handbook for office staff, which includes detailed tutorials on content creation applying the brand’s image through PenPot and approachable informative content on graphic design principles for digital content.
instagramFeedCaption: Instagram feed and introductory motion graphics
webParagraph: The official web page for the Information Service was redesigned as well and implemented officially in January 2025, improving previous user experience and interface. Every graphic in the web was made as a template in PenPot so any member of the team can easily edit it.
statsWebCaption: Comparative statistics of web page performance before and after the redesign. Source: Google Analytics.
statsInstagramCaption: Comparative statistics of Instagram content performance before and after the redesign. Source: Instagram Statistics.
thesisHonoursParagraph:
This Bachelor’s Degree Thesis was graded Honours, the maximum and extraordinary grade that can be obtained in a subject at university in Spain, and was awarded Second Prize for Best Inclusive Bachelor’s Degree Thesis by Cátedra Once Tiflotecnología for its improvements in the area of accessibility in the design academic field.

These results highlight the need to continue investing in accessible and sustainable tools, collaborative working methods, and an understanding of design that goes beyond aesthetics, as a key strategy for innovation and adaptation within a university environment shaped by economic uncertainty.

damnedParagraph: This design was commissioned by the streetwear brand The Damned Shop. The brief was to create a trendy accessory that was affordable to produce, durable, and high-quality, with strong viral potential. I developed the Damned Babys: phone holders that attach to the back of the device. They are sold in surprise boxes to increase anticipation and encourage social media sharing. The design sold out completely in under a week.
damnedInspirationParagraph: I was inspired by the Sonny Angel and Labubu trends and noticed a clear pattern between them: both are cute yet slightly creepy, easy to carry anywhere, and designed as collectible objects. They are also highly Instagrammable, as they are integrated into everyday items such as phones or bags. In addition, both are sold in surprise boxes, a key factor in building anticipation and driving their success. Damned Baby was created under those main principles.
damnedProcessParagraph:
Once the sketch was approved by the brand, I began modeling the design in 3D and contacting toy manufacturers. However, the production quotes we received were over budget.
To solve this, I chose to 3D print the design in order to create silicone molds and produce resin casts of the figure. These were then airbrushed and hand-painted, as shown.
This approach significantly reduced production costs and made the release highly profitable. Additionally, the hand-painted finish added extra value to the product and that was reflected in the public's response, selling out the product in under a week.
